name: Dynamic Stretching Circle
description: Players form a circle and perform a sequence of dynamic stretches to prepare the body for training.
setupInstructions: Place cones in a large circle
Position players evenly around the circle
Coach stands in the middle to demonstrate movements
coachingPoints: Ensure proper form during each movement
Maintain a steady pace throughout the sequence
Focus on controlled movements rather than speed
progressions: Add a ball to perform touches between stretches
Incorporate partner stretches
Add light jogging between movements

name: Passing Gates
description: Players pass through small gates made of cones while moving around the field, focusing on accurate passing and continuous movement.
setupInstructions: Set up 8-10 gates (two cones 2 yards apart) randomly across a 30x30 yard area
Divide players into pairs with one ball per pair
Pairs spread out across the area
coachingPoints: Emphasize clean first touch away from pressure
Encourage communication between partners
Focus on passing with proper weight and accuracy
progressions: Add a time challenge: how many gates can be passed through in 60 seconds
Require alternating feet for passes
Add defenders who try to intercept passes

name: 4v2 Rondo
description: A classic possession exercise where 4 attackers keep the ball away from 2 defenders in a confined space, focusing on quick decision making and precise passing.
setupInstructions: Create a 10x10 yard square with cones
Position 4 attackers on the outside of the square
Place 2 defenders inside the square
Provide attackers with one ball
coachingPoints: Maintain proper spacing between attackers
Play one or two-touch passes when possible
Create passing angles to support the player with the ball
Keep the ball moving to make defenders work
progressions: Limit to one-touch passing only
Add a third defender
Award points for splitting defenders with a pass

name: Possession Grid with Targets
description: Teams compete to maintain possession while trying to connect passes to target players positioned outside the grid.
setupInstructions: Create a 30x30 yard grid
Divide players into two equal teams (5v5 or 6v6)
Position 2 target players from each team on opposite sides of the grid
Give one team possession of the ball to start
coachingPoints: Create triangles and diamonds in possession
Scan the field before receiving the ball
Use appropriate passing techniques based on distance and pressure
Move immediately after passing to create new options
progressions: Award extra points for connecting with both target players in sequence
Limit touches based on player position or zone
Allow target players to move along their designated sideline

name: 1v1 to Goal
description: Attackers face defenders in 1v1 situations, focusing on beating opponents and finishing with quality shots on goal.
setupInstructions: Set up a 15x20 yard grid with a full-size goal at one end
Position goalkeeper in the goal
Create a starting cone 20 yards from goal for attackers
Set up a defender starting position 5 yards ahead of attacker
coachingPoints: Encourage attackers to be decisive and commit to their moves
Emphasize change of pace and direction to beat defenders
Focus on shooting technique and placement rather than power
Keep head up to read defender and goalkeeper positioning
progressions: Add a recovery defender chasing from behind
Set time limit of 8 seconds to finish the attack
Vary starting positions to create different angles

name: Crossing and Finishing Circuit
description: A dynamic drill focusing on delivering quality crosses and converting them with well-timed runs and accurate finishes.
setupInstructions: Set up a full-size goal with goalkeeper
Create crossing channels on both wings with cones
Position mannequins as passive defenders in the box
Create starting positions for crossers on wings and finishers centrally
coachingPoints: Vary crossing delivery (driven, floated, cut-back)
Time runs to arrive as the ball arrives, not before
Attack the space between defenders
Focus on different finishing techniques based on cross type
progressions: Add live defenders instead of mannequins
Require combination play before crossing
Limit touches for finishers (one-touch only)

name: Defensive Shadow Work
description: Players work in pairs with one player shadowing the other's movements to develop defensive footwork and positioning.
setupInstructions: Create 10x10 yard grid for each pair
Designate one player as leader and one as defender
Leader starts with ball at feet but doesn't dribble
coachingPoints: Maintain proper defensive stance with knees bent
Stay balanced and on balls of feet
Keep proper distance from attacker (arm's length)
Shuffle feet rather than crossing them
progressions: Allow leader to move the ball with feet
Expand to 2v2 shadow defending
Add directional focus toward a goal to protect

name: Channel Defending
description: Defenders work on channeling attackers away from dangerous areas and toward sidelines or support defenders.
setupInstructions: Create a 30x20 yard field with a goal at one end
Set up a central 'danger zone' with cones
Position two defenders against two attackers
Place small counter-attack goals at opposite end
coachingPoints: Position body to show attacker away from central zone
Communicate constantly between defenders
Delay the attack when outnumbered, don't dive in
Keep compact spacing between defenders
progressions: Add a third attacker to create 3v2 situation
Reward defenders for winning ball and scoring in counter goals
Start with attack already in progress rather than from static position

name: Technical Circuit
description: Players move through a series of technical stations focused on different ball skills, spending 3-4 minutes at each before rotating.
setupInstructions: Create 4-6 stations in a circuit formation
Station 1: Dribbling through cones
Station 2: Ball mastery exercises
Station 3: First touch and control drills
Station 4: Feints and moves practice
coachingPoints: Focus on quality repetitions rather than speed
Keep body position low and balanced during exercises
Use both feet equally throughout all stations
Encourage creativity and expression in the final station
progressions: Add time challenges at each station
Include small 1v1 competition elements
Combine skills from multiple stations into sequences

name: Four Corner Technical Practice
description: Players perform technical skills in a defined area with continuous movement between four corners, focusing on close control and quick direction changes.
setupInstructions: Set up a 15x15 yard square with cones at each corner
Each player with a ball starting at one of the corners
Mark each corner with a different color if possible
coachingPoints: Keep head up while dribbling to see open spaces
Use different surfaces of the foot for control
Execute sharp turns at each corner
Maintain close control throughout the exercise
progressions: Call out specific turns to perform at each corner
Add defenders who try to win the ball
Incorporate specific ball mastery moves between corners

name: Triangle Passing Combinations
description: Players work in groups of three forming triangles to practice various passing combinations and patterns with movement.
setupInstructions: Create triangles with cones (10 yards per side)
Position one player at each cone with one ball per triangle
Set up multiple triangles to accommodate all players
coachingPoints: Pass to the correct foot (usually the furthest from the defender)
Communicate before passing with verbal and visual cues
Move immediately after passing
Maintain proper passing technique with head up and follow through
progressions: Add specific passing patterns (e.g., all one-touch)
Incorporate movement between multiple triangles
Add passive then active defenders

name: Pass and Move Grid
description: Players work in a grid making passes and moving into space, focusing on accuracy, weight of pass, and intelligent movement patterns.
setupInstructions: Create a 25x25 yard grid
Split players into two teams with different colored bibs
Start with 2-3 balls depending on player numbers
coachingPoints: Scan the area before receiving the ball
Pass to teammates and follow your pass with a supporting run
Vary passing speed based on distance and positioning
Create passing angles by moving into space
progressions: Only allow passes to opposite-colored bibs
Add touch restrictions (two-touch, one-touch)
Introduce passive defenders

name: 3v3 End Zone Game
description: Teams compete in a small-sided format where points are scored by successfully dribbling into the opponent's end zone, encouraging quick transitions and creativity.
setupInstructions: Create a 25x20 yard playing area
Mark 3-yard end zones at each end
Divide players into teams of 3 (multiple games can run simultaneously)
coachingPoints: Look for opportunities to attack the end zone quickly
Support teammates in possession with angled runs
Transition quickly from defense to attack when winning the ball
Use width and depth to create space
progressions: Award extra points for combinations before scoring
Add neutral players to create overloads
Limit touches to increase speed of play

name: 4v4 Four Goal Game
description: Teams play 4v4 with four small goals positioned around the field, encouraging players to attack and defend in multiple directions.
setupInstructions: Set up a 30x30 yard square
Place four small goals at the middle of each side (facing inward)
Create two teams of 4 players with different colored bibs
coachingPoints: Constantly scan the field to identify open goals
Switch point of attack quickly to exploit open space
Defend the closest goal when out of possession
Use teammates to create overloads and goal-scoring opportunities
progressions: Assign each team two specific goals to attack and two to defend
Add a neutral player to create 5v4 situations
Award bonus points for scoring in all goals consecutively

name: Progressive Scrimmage
description: A structured full-sided scrimmage that begins with restricted conditions that gradually open up to full play, allowing players to apply skills in increasingly game-like situations.
setupInstructions: Set up appropriate sized field based on player numbers (half field for smaller groups)
Create balanced teams with different colored bibs
Position full-size goals at each end
coachingPoints: Maintain team shape in both attacking and defending phases
Apply quick transitions when possession changes
Use width and depth to create and exploit space
Apply principles practiced in earlier drills
progressions: Phase 1: Require 5 passes before scoring
Phase 2: Allow free play in the attacking third only
Phase 3: Fully unrestricted play

name: Conditioned Match Play
description: A game-realistic scrimmage with specific conditions or constraints designed to emphasize particular aspects of play or tactical concepts.
setupInstructions: Set up a field appropriate to player numbers
Divide players into balanced teams
Establish clear conditions for the game (e.g., one-touch finishing)
coachingPoints: Focus on applying the conditioned elements effectively
Encourage players to verbalize and solve problems together
Maintain competitive intensity throughout
Look for opportunities to apply practiced techniques in game situations
progressions: Vary conditions every 5-8 minutes
Add/remove players to create numerical advantages
Introduce zones where specific conditions apply

name: Overload Attack Waves
description: Attacking groups enter in waves against fewer defenders, focusing on exploiting numerical advantages and creating scoring opportunities.
setupInstructions: Set up a 30x40 yard field with a full-size goal at one end
Position defenders in the defensive half
Organize attackers into groups of 3 or 4 at the opposite end
Coach starts with a supply of balls
coachingPoints: Use quick movement and passes to disorganize the defense
Look for numerical advantage situations (2v1, 3v2)
Decision making: when to pass vs. when to dribble
Create and exploit space with off-ball movement
progressions: Begin with 3v1, progress to 3v2
Add recovery defenders who chase back
Set a time limit for each attacking wave (8-10 seconds)

name: Wide Play and Crossing
description: Focus on attacking from wide areas with an emphasis on quality crossing and intelligent movement in the penalty area.
setupInstructions: Create wide channels on both sides of the field
Set up a penalty area with a full-size goal and goalkeeper
Position 2-3 attackers in the box and 1-2 defenders
Designate players as wide attackers/crossers
coachingPoints: Vary crossing techniques based on defensive positioning
Time runs into the box to meet crosses
Create separation from defenders with sharp movement
Look for cut-back opportunities when defense collapses
progressions: Add fullbacks to create 1v1 situations with wide players
Require combination play before crossing
Introduce specific crossing targets (near post, far post, cut-back)

name: Third-Man Running Pattern
description: A structured passing pattern focusing on the concept of third-man runs, where a player not directly involved in the initial pass becomes the target for the next sequence.
setupInstructions: Set up a 30x30 yard grid
Position players in specific locations to create passing triangles
Use different colored cones to mark starting positions
coachingPoints: Focus on pass accuracy and weight
Time runs to arrive as the ball is played
Communicate with verbal and non-verbal cues
Maintain proper body position to see the field
progressions: Add passive defenders
Increase speed of execution
Combine multiple patterns into more complex sequences

name: Positional Rotation Pattern
description: Players execute a predetermined sequence of passes and movements with specific position rotations, simulating game situations and building team coordination.
setupInstructions: Set up in a formation section (e.g., midfield and attack)
Position mannequins as passive defenders
Assign starting positions for all players
Mark rotation paths with cones if needed
coachingPoints: Move immediately after passing to create new options
Maintain team shape throughout the rotation
Execute with proper timing to create space for teammates
Scan before receiving to know your next action
progressions: Begin with set pattern, then allow creative variations
Add active defenders to increase realism
Create transition to finish with a shot on goal

name: Corner Kick Variations
description: Practice a variety of corner kick routines with specific movement patterns and delivery types, focusing on creating scoring opportunities from set pieces.
setupInstructions: Set up a full-size goal with goalkeeper
Position attackers in and around the penalty area
Set up defenders to create realistic opposition
Prepare multiple balls for corner kick delivery
coachingPoints: Focus on consistent, quality delivery to target areas
Time runs to arrive as the ball reaches the target zone
Use blocking and screening movements to create space
Practice both in-swinging and out-swinging deliveries
progressions: Begin with unopposed practice, then add defenders
Introduce specific routines (near post, far post, short corners)
Practice defensive clearances and counter-attacks

name: Free Kick Organization
description: Comprehensive training for both attacking and defending free kicks around the penalty area, focusing on technique, coordination, and execution.
setupInstructions: Set up a full-size goal with goalkeeper
Position free kick mannequins to form a defensive wall
Mark different free kick positions around the penalty area
Assign specific roles to players (takers, wall, runners)
coachingPoints: For takers: Focus on technique, accuracy and communication
For defenders: Proper wall setup and covering open spaces
Execute deception moves and dummy runs
Maintain concentration and discipline throughout the routine
progressions: Replace mannequins with active defenders
Practice specific routines for different areas of the field
Add goalkeeping coaching specific to free kick situations

name: Interval Dribbling Circuit
description: A high-intensity interval training circuit that combines dribbling and technical skills with fitness development, maintaining ball contact throughout.
setupInstructions: Create a continuous circuit with multiple stations
Include dribbling slalom, sprints, and recovery areas
Each player with a ball
Set work:rest intervals (e.g., 30 seconds work, 15 seconds rest)
coachingPoints: Maintain technical quality even when fatigued
Push intensity during work intervals
Use appropriate recovery techniques during rest periods
Focus on proper running mechanics and body position
progressions: Increase work intervals or decrease rest periods
Add complexity to technical elements
Incorporate competitive elements between players

name: Position-Specific Conditioning Game
description: A small-sided game format designed to replicate the physical demands of specific positions, combining tactical understanding with position-specific conditioning requirements.
setupInstructions: Create a playing area appropriately sized for player numbers
Establish position-specific zones or channels
Assign specific positional roles to players
Set game duration and rest intervals
coachingPoints: Emphasize realistic movement patterns for each position
Encourage appropriate high-intensity actions (sprints, recovery runs)
Focus on tactical decision-making while fatigued
Maintain positional discipline throughout
progressions: Add specific conditioning challenges for certain positions
Incorporate overload situations that increase physical demands
Reduce recovery time between games as fitness improves

name: 6v6 + 3 Counter Pressing
description: A possession game where two teams of 6 compete to string passes together while using 3 neutral players. Neutrals can only be used after the 2nd pass, forcing teams to build play first before finding the free man.
setupInstructions: Mark out a 24x30 yard grid
Split into two teams of 6 players
Position 3 neutral players throughout the grid
Give one team the ball to start
coachingPoints: Win the ball back immediately after losing it
Build through your own team first before using neutrals
Keep the ball moving to stretch the defense
Neutrals should position between lines to stay available
progressions: Reduce passes needed to score
Add a time limit per possession
Limit neutral players to one touch
author: Matt Danaher (@mattdanaher)

name: Attacking from Wide Areas
description: A functional drill focusing on building attacks through wide channels. Features 2v1 situations in each wide channel and 3v2 in the central area. Wide attackers combine to beat defenders and deliver crosses into the box for finishing opportunities.
setupInstructions: Create two wide channels 12x25 yards on each wing, marked at the halfway point
Central area is everything between the wide channels
Place a full-sized goal with keeper at the attacking end
Place mini goals at the bottom of each wide channel for defensive counter-attacks
Position 2 attackers and 1 defender in each wide channel
Position 3 attackers and 2 defenders in the central area
coachingPoints: Wide attackers should use combinations (give & go, overlaps, underlaps) to beat the defender
Once in the attacking half of the wide channel, get the cross in quickly
Central attackers should time their runs into the box for the cross
Vary the type of cross (driven, floated, cutback) based on defender positioning
Wide defender must commit to stopping the 2v1 before the halfway line
progressions: Allow the wide defender to follow into the attacking half for a contested cross
Add a third central defender to increase difficulty
Require a one-touch finish in the box
Time limit from initial pass to shot on goal
author: Matt Danaher (@mattdanaher)
